skill.name: brainstorming
skill.description: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding functionality, or modifying behavior. Explores user intent, requirements and design before implementation.
skill.summary: You MUST use this before any creative work - creating features, building components, adding function...
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation with AI behavior guidelines. No executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution. The file guides collaborative design dialogue through natural conversation prompts.

content.user_title: Explore ideas through collaborative design dialogue
content.value_statement: Starting implementation without clear requirements leads to rework and missed expectations. This skill guides structured brainstorming conversations to understand intent, explore alternatives, and validate designs before writing code.
actual_capabilities: Asks focused questions one at a time to understand user intent
Presents designs in sections of 200-300 words for validation
Covers architecture, components, data flow, error handling, and testing
Writes validated designs to documentation files
Creates git worktrees and implementation plans for next steps
limitations: Does not execute code or access filesystem directly
Does not integrate with external APIs or services
Does not generate diagrams or visual artifacts
Requires user engagement in dialogue to refine ideas

use_cases.title: Define feature requirements
use_cases.description: Clarify feature scope and success criteria through guided dialogue before development begins

use_cases.title: Explore technical approaches
use_cases.description: Compare different architectural patterns and their trade-offs for new system components

use_cases.title: Validate design assumptions
use_cases.description: Iteratively review design sections to ensure alignment with business needs and technical constraints

prompt_templates.title: Start a new feature
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to explore a new feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to help design [describe your feature idea]. Start by understanding the project context and asking questions to clarify the requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Compare approaches
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to explore different approaches for [specific implementation challenge]. Present 2-3 options with their trade-offs.

prompt_templates.title: Review design sections
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to present the next section of the [feature name] design. Ask if it looks right so far and adjust based on feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Prepare for implementation
prompt_templates.scenario: When transitioning from design to code
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the brainstorming skill to set up the implementation workspace. Create a git worktree and write a detailed implementation plan.

output_examples.input: Help me design a user notification system
output: First, let me understand the project context. What type of application is this, and where is the existing codebase located?
To clarify the notification scope: Who should receive notifications? (A) All users, (B) Users who opt-in, (C) Admin-selected users only

best_practices: Start brainstorming early in the project lifecycle before any code is written
Ask one question at a time and wait for clear answers before proceeding
Push back on unnecessary features using YAGNI (You Aren't Gonna Need It) principle
anti_patterns: Skipping brainstorming and jumping straight to implementation
Asking multiple questions in a single message
Presenting complete designs without incremental validation

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires an AI assistant that can follow multi-step prompting guidelines.

faq.question: How detailed should my initial idea be?
faq.answer: Start with a brief description of what you want to achieve. The skill will ask clarifying questions to refine scope and requirements.

faq.question: Does this skill write code?
faq.answer: No. This skill focuses on design exploration and specification. Use implementation skills for actual code generation.

faq.question: Is my design data stored anywhere?
faq.answer: Designs are written to local docs/plans directory if you choose to save them. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if I disagree with the AI recommendations?
faq.answer: The skill encourages dialogue. Provide feedback when recommendations do not match your needs, and the AI will adjust.

faq.question: How is this different from regular chat?
faq.answer: This skill enforces a structured approach with focused questions, trade-off analysis, and incremental validation for better outcomes.
